sub_title: Simplifying the context for business managers as a multi-passionate consultant
summary:
I will simplify your context as a multi-passionate consultant and make the 'geek speak' that is commonly used in our industry more actionable.

Why multi-passionate consultant? Well, I'm someone that loves helping others and unravelling challenges that no one has an answer to. I practice this in my professional life mainly during my collaboration with CERN (2022) and my current job at Deloitte. My current focus points are Business Model Transformation, SAP transition paths and new venture creation. I try to practice this habit in my personal life as well with my everchanging hobbies.  

I've always had interest in different industries and projects which is also reflected in my study and work background. I'm an honors graduate MSc Strategic Management, did an MBA semester at Babson college (#1 School of Entrepreneurship in the USA) and hold a BSc in Business Administration. 

Looking for someone who brings a new perspective to your project? Let's grab a coffee and see how we can make it work. 

✉️ fleurmilder@hotmail.com 
☎️ +31 (0)6 10 13 59 59

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University
Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

awards.title: MSc Honours Programme RSM
awards.description: The MSc Honours Programme of RSM is open to 25 students of the Master programme in Strategic Management (over 400 students) who have successfully finished all their courses at first chance, without taking any re-sit; who have obtained a grade point average of at least 7.5 on the Dutch grading scale 1 - 10 and who possess demonstrable interest in consulting, strategy and innovation. Moreover, students have also shown proficiency in the English language and take the 10 ECTS Honours Programme alongside their regular full-time studies.

projects.title: CERN x Ideasquare Design Thinking
projects.description: Working in 5 multidisciplinary teams in Geneva, Switzerland on a groundbreaking new technology (Unicorn Dx) from research institutes like CERN, Nikhef and Ideasquare (ATTRACT program). Investigated the potential value of these technologies and their performance in new applications, while following a Design Thinking approach. The end result was a business proposal on for a new startup in 2 domains that are ready for implementation.

projects.title: Strategic Business Plan
projects.description: Conducted a strategical audit for BG Door International BV. Coaching in academic research & writing, critical analysis skills and grading exams, papers and additional assignments.

profile_positions.description:
Coordinating and teaching weekly bachelor (BSc) workshop sessions in International Business for several student groups of third year (international) Business Administration students. 

Teaching academic research & writing, critical thinking, negotiating, globalization and assessing student examinations and assignments.

profile_positions.description: 1 out of 25 students that worked as an external consultant for Port of Rotterdam under the guidance of Monitor Deloitte. Formulated and proposed the new strategy and business model regarding the hydrogen transition in the world.

During the overnight camp in Barcelona (2019) I was responsible for organising and coordinating the meals for approx. 180 pax. This includes decorating, organising, being the contact person for the staff and children and preparing the food.

profile_positions.description:
Due to the variation in clients of Rent A Butler, my work varies from bartender, hostess, representative and much more. Because I am placed at a different location each time, flexibility and fast learning is a requirement in my job. 

A brief selection of clients I have worked with; SBV Excelsior Business Lounge, Parkhotel Rotterdam, De Harbourclub, Hal4, Rotterdamse Kost, CuliNESSE and Van der Valk Hotels.

company.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

volunteer_experiences.description:
As an International Ambassador for the RSM faculty of the Erasmus University Rotterdam I am responsible for 8-10 internationals every academic year (from USA, Canada, Australia, China, Iceland etc.) who come to study in the Netherlands. My task is to make sure that the students find their way, plan activities, support their studies and be the contact person if they have questions and/or problems during their stay. 
Global - Communication - Guidance - English

At the ESN Buddy Program I was a guide for six international students at the Erasmus University from Taiwan, France, India and Poland. I shared my time and knowledge about Rotterdam and the Netherlands with them to make the integration as smooth as possible. Among other things, I provided support in arranging accommodation and insurance.
Global - Communication - Guidance - English
